newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid share trading up 83.4 pct in Jan-May.
newsitem.headline: Madrid share trading up 83.4 pct in Jan-May.

text.p: Trading in shares listed on Madrid's bourse in the first five months of the year rose to 8.06 trillion pesetas, 83.4 percent higher than the same period last year, official data showed on Friday.
That was despite a fall in total trading value at the bourse, including cash government bonds, which lost 13.38 percent to 9.7 trillion pesetas from January to May.
Trading in public debt alone fell 77 percent, in the same period, while the volume of exchanges in private debt fell 20 percent to around 174 billion pesetas.
